snippet.title: Kyle begs Eddie for diet tips: 'I'm 135 kilos, help'
snippet.content:
KIIS FM shock jock Kyle Sandilands has revealed he has tipped the scales at 135 kilograms before asking media personality Eddie McGuire for help. McGuire after revealing he had shed a whopping 20kg in a matter of weeks following an extreme diet. The intensive 12-week program is based on Chinese herbs and involves not eating or drinking anything other than three cups of herb tonic a day for the first two weeks.
During an on-air interview on the Kyle and Jackie O Show, Sandilands, 46, told McGuire: "I'm 135 kilos Eddie - help me." "It does take a bit of mental strength to get through but I found it relatively easy going," McGuire told the hosts, detailing his diet. "You have the herbs but also you go and get the acupuncture and a massage for the first couple of weeks and also get weighed in everyday so that gets you a bit honest."
"You're probably the same Kyle, you've probably put on a kilo-and-a-half or two kilos every year." Sandilands is shown holding up five fingers to his co-host Jackie O. "You reckon I put on five (kilos) a year Jackie?" he was heard asking, which she nods in agreement. "Jesus." McGuire responded by complimenting Sandilands, describing him as a "strong-minded bloke." "You get belligerent like I did and when everyone starts pushing food in front of you, offering you drinks or saying you weren't working and then when it's all done they say, 'You're a plonk of fat'," he added. Sandilands quipped "I'm in" when McGuire said people were allowed to smoke during the diet. Originally published as
